title: 107_s1733
content: The Act titled "Name Matching for Enforcement and Security Act of 2001" establishes an interoperable law enforcement and intelligence data system with name matching capacity and training. The Act requires the development of a unified electronic data system by key government agencies to access relevant information for visa issuance and alien admissibility. The system must have name matching capacity, be linguistically sensitive, provide user support, and involve consultation with private sector firms. The unified electronic database must be searchable on a linguistically sensitive basis, provide user support, and be developed in consultation with private sector firms. It should utilize commercially available platforms and be continuously adjusted and improved based on experience and advancements in technology and sciences. The database must also account for variations in name formats and transliterations within a particular language for effective searches. The unified electronic database must be searchable based on linguistically sensitive algorithms that incorporate advanced linguistic, mathematical, statistical, and anthropological research. Linguistically sensitive algorithms should be developed for at least 4 high-priority languages. Adequate user support should be provided with authoritative information about names. The Director of Central Intelligence, along with other key officials, must submit reports every 6 months on the progress of implementing the unified electronic data system, which includes providing authoritative information about names in different languages and a means for communication with experts. Intelligence agencies must adhere to current standards within 60 days. The Director of Central Intelligence must submit reports on implementing the unified electronic data system every 6 months. Intelligence agencies must adhere to current standards within 60 days and issue guidelines within 120 days. Authorization of appropriations is provided for necessary funding. The development and implementation of a data system under this section require consultation with various government agencies and the intelligence community. The system must adhere to technology standards established by the USA PATRIOT Act. Access to information in the data system is subject to certain conditions. The data system developed under this section must adhere to technology standards set by the USA PATRIOT Act. Information in the system is accessible to Foreign Service officers issuing visas and Federal agents determining alien admissibility. Access to intelligence information is restricted by the Secretary of State, Attorney General, and Director of Central Intelligence.
